description.narrative: Bio Pappel S.A.B. de C.V. (Bio Pappel or the Company) is a Mexican, family-owned, company engaged in the manufacturing of paper and paper products with paper mills, corrugated boxes and notebook factories, and recycled paper collection centers in Mexico, U.S. and Colombia. The proposed project will support expansion of Durango paper mill, biomass-based cogeneration facilities in paper mills in Durango and Oaxaca and investments in new recycled paper collection centers, among others (the Project).

The Project's main development impacts include: - Job Creation: About 700 direct new jobs are expected to be created as part of this project, including construction jobs at the Durango plant, operational jobs across the new biomass and upgraded Durango plants, and employment at the new collection centers. About 75% of the investments supported by the Project will be located in Durango state, which is a relatively poorer state with income per capita below the national average and poverty rates above the national average. - Environmental Effects: The Project has been classified as fully "Climate Smart" and will result in significantly above average contribution to the country's sustainability agenda. Supported investments are expected to increase paper recycling rates in the country and biomass-based electricity cogeneration, contributing towards Mexico's aspirations for low carbon growth.
